description.text: printouts from multiple-aligned protein or DNA sequences

xhtml:div.label: Output format POSTSCRIPT (1) Encapsulated POSTSCRIPT (2) HPGL (3) RTF (Rich Text Format) (4) ANSI-screen (PC-version) (6) VT100-screen (DEC-version) (7) ReGIS-screen (25 lines each) (8) ReGIS-file (without breaks) (9) LJ250-printer file (a) FIG file (for XFIG) (c) PICT file (d) HTML (e)
Should sequence name be printed Yes No
Display ruler line Yes No
How many sequence characters per line
How many lines between two sequence blocks
Character size in Points (except for HTML and ASCII output formats)

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label: Save Shading/Text Save shading (S) Save Shading+Text (T)
Rotate plot Yes No
Special label for similar residues Yes No
Special label for identical residues in all sequences Yes No
Display consensus line Yes No

Identity threshold?
The threshold is the fraction of residues that must be identical or similar for shading to occur.

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.label: Background for different residues Black (B) White (W) Gray value: 1 Gray value: 2 Gray value: 3 Gray value: 4 (darkest) Red (R) Green (G) Blue (L) Yellow (Y) Magenta (M) Cyan (C)

Foreground for different residues (lowercase choices mean lowercase letters in the sequence) Black (B) Black (b) White (W) White (w) Gray value: 1 Gray value: 2 Gray value: 3 Gray value: 4 = darkest Gray value: 5 (lowercase) Gray value: 6 (lowercase) Gray value: 7 (lowercase) Gray value: 8 = darkest (lowercase) Red (R) Red (r) Green (G) Green (g) Blue (L) Blue (l) Yellow (Y) Yellow (y) Magenta (M) Magenta (m) Cyan (C) Cyan (c)
